channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: US judge withdraws approval for abortion pill during Texas case
item.description: Judge Matthew Kacsmaryk has placed a temporary stay on the FDA approval for mifepristone, used in medical abortions.

item.title: Israel-Palestine: Qatar working to ‘de-escalate situation’
item.description: Qatari official says Gulf country in touch with both sides 'in the context of its role as a mediator'.

item.title: Lula government struggles to rein in deforestation in Brazil
item.description: Preliminary data finds deforestation in the month of March increased 14 percent over the same month last year.

item.title: What triggered the increase in violence in the Middle East?
item.description: Violence raised fears of wider confrontation, as well as questions about what this means for already fractured relations

item.title: Amid turmoil, Pakistan to launch operation against armed groups
item.description: Pakistan is in danger of defaulting on its debt while a bruising political battle is raging between govt and ex-PM Khan.

item.title: One killed, several injured in Tel Aviv attack
item.description: A 30-year-old Italian man has been killed and several others have been injured in the incident, authorities say.

item.title: US Justice Clarence Thomas responds to unreported luxury travel
item.description: The Supreme Court justice says he has 'sought to comply' with rules after ProPublica revealed apparent law violation.

item.title: Republicans furious at Biden’s Afghanistan review, Democrats mum
item.description: A review released by the White House largely blamed former President Trump for chaotic US pullout from Afghanistan.

item.title: Canadian Arctic Snow School hopes to boost climate fight
item.description: Researchers hope first-ever ‘Arctic Snow School’ in Nunavut will bolster cooperation, understanding of changing region.

item.title: Who fired rockets into Israel from southern Lebanon?
item.description: While no group has claimed responsibility, Israel blames the Palestinian group Hamas in Lebanon for barrage of rockets.

item.title: Peace talks must have ‘Russian interests, concerns’, says Lavrov
item.description: Earlier this week, Moscow said it had no choice but to continue its more than yearlong offensive in Ukraine.

item.title: Buenos Aires airport turns into unofficial homeless shelter
item.description: With inflation and poverty soaring in Argentina, dozens are taking shelter in the capital city's 'Aeroparque' airport.

item.title: Russia charges WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich with spying: Reports
item.description: Russian media say the journalist denied the espionage charge and said he was engaged in journalistic activities.

item.title: Eritrea’s government should not be allowed to harm peace in Ethiopia
item.description: President Afwerki's determination to continue his feud with the TPLF is jeopardising stability in the Horn of Africa.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: Rouble tumbles to lowest in a year
item.description: Rouble falls to lowest against dollar and euro since April last year in the face of a foreign currency crunch in Moscow.

item.title: How teachers and librarians are subverting book bans in the US
item.description: Books on race and gender identity are the subject of a record number of book bans in the United States.

item.title: US job growth strong in March, unemployment falls to 3.5 percent
item.description: The strong job numbers could lead the Fed to continue to raise interest rates.

item.title: Saudi-led coalition lifts import restrictions in south Yemen
item.description: Saudi-backed government says commercial ships will be allowed to dock directly in southern ports, including Aden.

item.title: Why are migrant children working dangerous jobs in the US?
item.description: It is an 'open secret' that many children who cross the border into the US alone end up working, experts say.

item.title: UAE court dismisses S Africa request to extradite Gupta brothers
item.description: The Guptas, arrested in the UAE in 2022, are accused of siphoning state funds using connections with ex-President Zuma.

item.title: Ramadan recipe: In Sudan, fuul completes the iftar table
item.description: Our iftar table is not complete unless it has a dish of hot, well-seasoned fuul, studded with chopped veggies, on it.

item.title: WHO chief urges China to share information on COVID origins
item.description: Global health agency scientists say new Chinese study released this week offered some 'clues' on origins but no answers.

item.title: How has the Saudi-Iran divide affected the Middle East?
item.description: The two leading regional powers have been at odds for years, backing opposite sides in proxy wars.

item.title: Pakistan army says top Balochistan separatist leader arrested
item.description: Gulzar Imam, a 'high-value target' according to military, is founder and leader of banned Baloch Nationalist Army.

item.title: Two killed in occupied West Bank after Israel bombs Gaza, Lebanon
item.description: Killings near illegal Hamra settlement take place hours after Israeli air raids targeted Lebanon and Gaza.
